intro: Keiskea szechuanensis, commonly known as the Sichuan keiskea, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are leathery and dark green, providing a striking contrast to its delicate blooms. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas at higher elevations.
